  • Method Details

    • decodeInstruction

      public String decodeInstruction(String instruction, int currentAddress) throws SyntaxException, RangeException
      Decodes an instruction with an offset value to its binary representation.
      Specified by:
      decodeInstruction in interface Decoder
      Parameters:
      instruction - The assembly instruction with an offset value to decode.
      currentAddress - The current memory address of the instruction.
      Returns:
      The binary representation of the instruction.
      Throws:
      SyntaxException - if the instruction is unsupported, missing parameters, or if the offset value is not found.
      RangeException - if the offset value is out of range.

    • extractParameters

      public int[] extractParameters(String instruction, int currentAddress) throws SyntaxException, RangeException
      Extracts parameters from the instruction.
      Specified by:
      extractParameters in interface Decoder
      Parameters:
      instruction - The assembly instruction.
      currentAddress - The current memory address of the instruction.
      Returns:
      An array containing extracted parameters: rd, rs, and offset value.
      Throws:
      SyntaxException - if the offset value is not found in the instruction.
      RangeException - if the offset value is out of range.
